rows.text: A former Boston University military history professor who becomes the second-in-command of the Second Massachusetts resistance, a roughly 300 strong group of civilians and fighters fleeing Boston, which was lost to alien invaders. His sons are Hal, Ben, taken by Skitters, and Matt - all one year older in season 2. Aliens killed his wife out gathering food supplies with the doctor who discovers how to safely remove the harnesses used by aliens to control human children. He and Dr Anne Glass have become friends, and more. Season 1 ends with Tom boarding an alien shuttle with Karen and one of the immensely tall skinny overlords, hoping to stop his son Ben's changes. In season 2, Tom is freed, and he finds his way back home. Between Seasons 2 and 3, Tom was elected President of the New United States, but continues to fight alongside the 2nd Mass, seeing himself as a war leader who belongs on the front lines.

Tom's youngest son makes a birthday wish in season 1 that everything return as before the invasion, but soon volunteers to help Scott with the radio, then Pope with making mech-killing ammunition. In season 2 Matt helps more with the fighting, like protecting Anne. In season 3 he is fighting in the war and is a big help to everyone.

Maggie was at one time reluctantly part of Pope's gang but kills his brother and another rapist ("He thought he was better because he brought chocolate - he wasn't") and rescues Tom, Hal, and their squad. A tough fighter, Margaret teaches Anne how to shoot and works hard to earn her new place. She admits to Hal that she knows the hospital where the harnessed Ben is held because she had cancer at 16. In "Death March", she reveals that after chemotherapy for brain tumors, she fled, but was arrested while three months pregnant, and gave birth in jail. In season 3 she and Hal enter a relationship and are very happy. When she figures out Hal might be the mole she protects him.

The former college student assists Anne, and proudly displays her still strong Catholic religion. In season 2, she shifts romantic interest from Hal to Jarmil and is devastated when Jamil is killed by Skitters. In Season 3, she is still helping Anne with the medical department in Charleston, but has been mysteriously infected with eye worms, which cause her to attempt to destabilize Charleston from within. She is later discovered as the mole, and her eye worms are removed by Alexis.

The leader of a post-apocalyptic gang that ambushes Tom's squad when they scout an armory, killing one scout, Click, silently with a bow and arrow. Pope then sends Hal to offer Weaver a trade: hostages returned for the gun mounted on a truck. Anne volunteers to return and patch up Pope's brother, but Maggie shoots her rapists dead and leads Tom's squad free. Pope eventually serves as the 2nd Mass' cook, but rides away after leading them to a motorcycle store. But when all the children are captured by a human traitor, Pope helps them escape, and makes new "mech" metal bullets that can finally kill the invading machines. His character is both good and bad, complicated. In season 2 he leads The Berserkers, including Lyle, Tector, Crazy Lee, and Anthony. He leaves with Anthony at one point but returns alone to 2nd Mass. In Season 3 Pope is seen to have opened a bar in Charleston, often speaking out regarding the alliance with the Volm, and continues to fight as a member of the Berserkers.

Fighter, former Boston cop, part of Tom's team and The Berserkers.

A member of the Volm species, he befriends Tom and aids Charleston in the fight against the Espheni. It is later revealed he is the son of the Volm Commander.

A fighter. Observing how Tom worries about his sons, Dai wryly comments that his lack of family at the time of the invasion has a positive side. In the season 2 finale, Skitters kill him.

Teen scout and Hal's ex-girlfriend, captured when Mike is freed in the mission to retrieve Ben. Harnessed and completely indoctrinated, her role in season 3 speculates that she has replaced the deceased overlord. She tries to establish a truce with Tom and warns him not to trust the Volm, but Tom shoots her, with Maggie delivering the final blows while Karen is saying goodbye to Hal.
